Reviews.Title: “Return visit after 2.5 years - just as good as before”
Reviews.Author: dleroc
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Estrel for a friend's birthday party over the Easter period and stayed 4 nights. For 2 nights the hotel was full but the service remained excellent, despite having breakfast being made available for 1300 residents! The choice of bars and restaurants is excellent as is the evening presence of the pianist at the Piano Bar and the occasional session with one or two of the impersonators from the Stars in Concert show which we saw last time. On this occasion Elvis and and Marilyn Monroe were around and sang a few numbers! The Estrel works hard at providing a comfortable setting to keep you at the hotel, even though the Strassenbahn station is nearby. However on this occasion the train was replaced by a bus service which was a bit more inconvenient. In conversations with the staff it is clear that they enjoy working there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzyT10
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights due to conference attendance, which was very convenient. Room was large & quiet, but necessary to open window for fresh air. Need to request extra pillows as only one flat one provided. If like convenience of teas/coffees you need to take own travel kettle, etc. We purchased our travel tickets from the concierge & used the M41 bus to take us into the city centre from a short walk 'round the corner.' Macdonalds, an Aldi supermarket, large drugstore, cafe, ices & cakes are a short walk in the opposite direction to the city. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here. Overall we really enjoyed the ambience & customer service this hotel provides.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for an average Berlin hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Patersoneditha
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an average hotel in Berlin, Estrel is your answer. Everything is average, hotel room, eateries, food, service, even the 10-year old, small TV in your room. I asked the coinceirge where can I find a taxi and his answer was "outside, not inside". Oh, yes, the "very helpful answer" was the only thing below average. Well, perhaps, I was just a bit shocked since I just trasferred from Hilton Berlin before checking-in at Estrel for the World Coin Fair.

Reviews.Title: “Conference hotel: OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: angolasue
Reviews.Content: I had 4 nights here as I was attending a conference here. It was very convenient to stay in the same hotel, but I was disappointed with the overall standard of the hotel. The food was very good & reasonably priced. The hotel is close to both an s-bann train station and a bus stop that goes into the part of the city tourists want to visit, so its location isn't a disaster. It is quite far from the airport - over 30 euros in a taxi. They were also very willing to allow late check out (4pm) if the room wasn't booked for the following night. The rooms didn't have an electric kettle - despite having an area designed for this. There were also no complementary toiletries - a large bottle of shampoo was in the shower and liquid soap next to the basin (but no soap in the shower). I felt this was rather cheap given the over 100 euros per night charge. Breakfast was a comprehensive buffet, but as a vegetarian I was somewhat surprised that the hot food consisted of scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs and then lots of bacon & sausages - no tomatoes, no mushrooms, no potatoes or baked beans even! The other major let-down was the internet - 3 euros per hour that was billed directly to your room. My frustration is that there was no timer provided, nor did it automatically cut off after 1 hour, so if you didn't watch the time VERY carefully you would easily end up being charged an extra 3 euro. Of course this also meant that you can't use your "hour" in pieces - once you login, your 3 euros is gone, even if you are online for just 10 minutes. Internet was provided via a cable in your room or wifi (same price) in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indy_traveler-111
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property in about two years. My impression during the most recent stay was more favorable than the first. The service seemed better, food quality very good and best of all the room I was in apeared to be newly remodeled. I had one minor tv problem while there which they promptly fixed. The only real downside is the location. It is in a rundown industrial neighborhood on the edge of Berlin. That said, it is right at an S-Bahn stop so you can easily get to nicer parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Canis_Family
Reviews.Content: The Service in this hotel is better than in most expensive 5 Star hotels! They went above and beyond in every situation. We travelled with a small child and a dog, and allthough both were the only ones there, they made both feel welcome. The room was comfortable, clean and very modern. Only the bathroom was a bit outdated. The only bad thing is the neighborhood. It is not very central and does not seem very safe. They do, however, have a nice parking garage for 15 EUR a night.

Reviews.Title: “Conferencing in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas11111111111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is big and the conference areas are good. The food is very good. The rooms are modern. The beds are on the hard side, very hard even. The cancellation policy is crazy, 28 days or no refund. Extremly expensive if you need to change uoyr reservation somewhat as i had to. Internet is "free" only in teh lobby. Romms have no wireless and wired internet is extremely expensive 24 Euro per day. The area is not nice at all. I would not recommend this hotel. Sorry

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and friedly staff, but miserable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Waspbiter
Reviews.Content: We attend te Estrel every year for a Trade show. My strongest advice is if you can avoid actually staying here then do so. The staff are excellent and the rooms are well appointed, but this is probably the most souless place you will ever visit. It has to be said that the conditions of the rooms can be quite variable. This year the shower is broken and due to the volume of attendees here, they are not able to move me to a new room, nor seemly repair the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient if you attend conference/exchibition”
Reviews.Author: axel7_11
Reviews.Content: I stay every year in this hotel. It is good and big hotel, rooms are nice. There is a good choice of hotels in Berlin, so would not recommend this hotel for tourists. Mainly because there's not much in the vicinity of the hotel, so you will be commuting fair bit to any of the city's attractions. But if one attends a function inside hotel it is a great place to stay,albeit priced on the high side .

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: This property seems to be made of several old building, united together by a covered hallway! Very good rooms, nice restaurants, huge parking. Not very close to public transportation, expensive Internet conection.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but wi-fi ripoff”
Reviews.Author: Snookoafc1
Reviews.Content: The Estrel is a huge hotel and conference centre with a large theatre attached. The rooms are generally well appointed, scrupulously clean, not overpriced and very functional. There is a wide range of restaurants, cafes and shops in the massive lobby. There is an S-bahn stop within two minutes' walk which is very handy and keeps down the costs as the taxis in Berlin are pretty expensive. The hotel would get five stars from me if it wasn't for the fact that it rips off its customers with wi-fi. Even in the lobby you pay €3 for an hour, but if, like me, you need your internet connection for business purposes you need it in your room 24 hours a day and that costs €24. Internet costs hotels nothing as they would want it installed for their own purposes, so to screw their guests is simply a rip-off. I now go out of my way to patronise hotels which don't charge.

Reviews.Title: “Top conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roy280211
Reviews.Content: Spent a week there at a conference. Facilities are all excellent - well maintained and modern. Food was varied and of a good quality and there are several different choices for evening meals within the hotel itself. Bedroom was large, clean and tidy. As a UK visitor I just expect tea/coffee facilities in the room, so was surprised that there were none. Bottled water was left in the room but at almost 5 Euros for a small bottle it's probably best to leave it alone! Although it's a fair way out of the city centre, public transport is plentiful. You can get a bus (think it was M41) from outside to Potsdamer Platz where there are lots of shops, and there is Sonnenallee Metro station just a couple of minutes walk too.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you must”
Reviews.Author: Halimbalo
Reviews.Content: In the south-eastern part of Berlin quite far away from everything the Estrel is an enormous hotel. Very big and very aged. If you are in the need to do a big conference or something similar its ok just because it offers an annex with a huge capacity for exhibitions etc. Staying there for any other reason then an inhouse fair means you are missing the chance to explore a nice hotel in Berlin. Nothing special (not even the price), very anonym and nothing to feel confortable about. The hotel offers free wifi at the lobby but as soon as you are in your room they charge you € 3.- per hour. The rooms are just ok but for sure not more then this. Some 15 years ago it was kind of state of the art but nowadays there are just too many other options that are allowing you to not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for conferences”
Reviews.Author: AlfacinhaLisboa
Reviews.Content: Estrel, the largest hotel in Europe (1000 rooms) is located in the outskirts of Berlin. It is a great hotel for conferences, for bus tours, but not for individuals as the city center by public transport is far away. As the hotel has been fully renovated, the rooms are very nice, cozy, clean and with some nice views from the top floors. Breakfast is good and so is the food in the various restaurants. The conference facilities are amazing. The cigar bar is also a nice touch as smoking is not allowed in the hotel. A private train station and boat station can make a conference unforgettable. They also have Las Vegas kind of shows that, apparently, attract locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... Great Price”
Reviews.Author: SAKader
Reviews.Content: Loved the place... Many restaurants to choose from. Has very good confrance facility. Room are very modern (in the new block). I would really recond this hotel to a friend, Its about 30 mins by Train from Down Town and hotel is walking distance to the train station

Reviews.Title: “Money Stolen from Room”
Reviews.Author: Jenna F
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, in respect to staff and services. We had nothing but good things to say about this place even regarding the locations. Although this suited as we have friends that live 10 mins down the road. all that said, we had our money stolen from out room which we hid in some clothing. So not only was it stolen but they had rummaged through our stuff too!! Unfortuanlty we did not realize until we reached Stanstead. I then contacted the hotel the next day, who told me they could not do anything about it and we should have informed them on check out-----Well if we knew we would have!! They said I would then receive a call back once the manager was there needless to say we are still waiting!!!

Reviews.Title: “Irish dancing weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Taylor353535
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Bedrooms very big and well equiped. Pity they werent more childrens menues available. My Children lived on pizza and chips for our 4 days stay. Bit out of town but is just beside train station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel service is lousy. DO NOT recommend to your friends!”
Reviews.Author: Cpyncc
Reviews.Content: Reason being, the bed is hard, the locations is bad, the hotel does not aim to make the occupants feel aafe. The security is a problem and little is done to create a professional and safe environment. Enquires on arranging airport transfers was a nightmare. Staff were not prompt or helpful and This adds on to the disgusting fact that this hotel is badly located.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service but far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: jakub-krakau
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and efficient. The facilities in the room are very modern and work very well. The room was spacious, has a nice balance between classic and modern and the bed was hard to get out of. Elegant bathroom. The buffet breakfast was also excellent, lots of variety with cold meat, eggs, bread, cookies and fruit salads. The poorest point is the location: not near the centre of Berlin, in the boring south section of the city. It's also very far from the Tegel Airport (A taxi costs around €60 and takes between 45 and 55 minutes). Fortunately, there is a variety of restaurants and bars within the hotel itself and this compensates a little for the isolated location of this place.

Reviews.Title: “I checked out and moved to the centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference here. The reason I left was twofold - 1. the bed was like a brick (all the beds in the hotel are the same when I asked) 2. I was traveling to the center of town to go to museums and eat so thought I might as well save my money and commute to Estrel rather than from Estrel. The hotel is near Somnalee station. This is on the S41-S42 S-bahn lines but not directly connected to the airports or the centre of Berlin. To get here you have the change at Treptower or Ostkreusz. Somnalee station has its issues - there are 2 exits - there is no sign to the Estrel Hotel on the platform or anywhere (you need the North exit). Upon reaching the street, I passed a number of men smoking and drinking. I turned around to find them harassing 2 female conference attendees who had just got off the same train. I walked back and escorted the ladies by the men who continued to make offense remarks and sounds. One of the ladies was particularly shaken. The hotel is not far away, you turn under the railway and walk 150m east over a river and turn left. There is no pedestrian crossing so its a game of chicken getting across the busy road. Once at the hotel, the entry way has a covered entrance but unfortunately this is aligned so that if you step out from it, you risk death under the wheels of a taxi! There is also the added charm of people smoking right at the entrance. The check in was routine. The room was large and quiet. Shower and storage OK. The bed was hard, very hard. I remade the bed with a blanket/comforter from house keeping to try and soften it. The food was schizophrenic. The conference food (?from caterer) was actually very good. I went to eat dinner the first night and this was really disappointing. I ordered a soup (OK) but the schnitizel was grossly over cooked and the edges were inedible. I mentioned this to the server in English and German and he just smiled at me and shrugged. There alcohol selection and pricing was good. I anaesthetised myself with a glass of Spanish red and called a friend, who was heading the Quasimodo's jazz club near Zoo Garten station. I wrapped up against rain and cold and headed back to the station. The same group of men are playing spin the bottle mit Polizei, I skirted them. I got to the club earlier than expected and walked the area, looking at hotel options. As I had a business meeting next day, I took my sore back and luggage with me and checked into another place. During the course of the conference, several people shared the feeling of being trapped with little to do. The recipe of Museums, interesting nightlife and eclectic dining that is Berlin was lost on many that attended this conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business, good transport links, not so good for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: evansd
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Estrel while on business in Berlin. It's a great place to come back to after long days attending shows and meeting clients, with spacious rooms, a good restaurant and friendly staff. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Sonnenallee station, and from here your only a short train journey from the city centre. The 171 bus connects Sonnenallee station with Schoenefeld airport, making for a cheap and convenient transfer to the hotel. This hotel is great for business, but if you're coming to Berlin as a tourist you'll want somewhere more centrally located. In addition, being situated in East Berlin, the neighbourhood surrounding the hotel is rather dreary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but location not great”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellerCalgary
Reviews.Content: For a large "convention" or "congress" hotel this is a nice property. The staff were excellent and service was very good. Rooms were comfortable and clean. There are many dining/bar options and the food was good. Our only complaint was the location- it is some distance from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Would not want to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationqueen84
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights last week. Beds are like a brick, one very soft pillow; I woke with a stiff neck and bad back each morning. Did not have one good night in this hotel. Shower did not work; window would not open. Breakfast just OK and location is not the best although the train is close by and takes you into the city in 1/2 hour. Some staff seemed friendly but some were aloof. Having stayed in Berlin before, I much prefer the Park Inn for comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable for business travellers, NOK for tourists”
Reviews.Author: MonicaAlina
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days at the hotel in June 2010. Pro's: the room was reasonably large and clean and the hotel staff friendly; the hotel is well-equiped for conferences. Con's: my window was locked with a key and did not open, the air conditionning in the room was pre-set, the food was barely acceptable, the internet connection was quite expensive (3 eur/ hour), not a good value/ price ratio. There is nothing to see in the surrounding area; I would not recommend the place to tourists. The hotel and the restaurants inside are non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Estrel Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MartijnG3
Reviews.Content: Very big hotel located near a S Bahn with direct connections to city centre. Hotel has several restaurants and the rooms are spacious. Hotel purpose is more business and conference so I personally would not really recommend it for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Its perfect for a big Convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnston255
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th consecutive year we have come to Berlin in January for a trade show and convention. The hotel caters very well for the large number of people who come to meet and greet, network and do business. Dining is limited but still very good. the staff are well organized and well use to convention crowds. The rooms are not great but more than adequate and the convention venue is interconnected with the hotel. the large central Bar is an excellent place to relax and catch up with colleagues and clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: NottsPanther
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for a conference with work. Staff were amazing, helpful and friendly couldn't ask for more. Food was quality and rooms were spacious. would recommend if you're travelling for business.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MartinR7
Reviews.Content: A bit hot rooms though, but refurbished and nice in general. F&b service was perfect! Great service overall, staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “SIFE World Cup”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastPortland
Reviews.Content: Great Food and very comfortable bed. The only the negative was the distance from the hotel to downtown, approx. 20 miles.

Reviews.Title: “huge hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jloSingapore
Reviews.Content: huge hotel with a huge breakfast spread. Complimentary apples at the check-in counter warms the heart...great job!

Reviews.Title: “Big, but decent”
Reviews.Author: rrooze
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly to Berlin, most of the time I stay in the Estrel since it's conventiently located near our office, Don't expect a super-dooper hotel, but do expect decent rooms. I must say that not all rooms have the same level of comfort. If you get an upgrade you'll probably ask yourself what that means because the rooms don't differ from the standard rooms. The extremely large hotel has several restaurants and bars. Breakfast is very good, the beds are fine, the staff is OK,TV-offering very German-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “How do you say complete rip-off in German?”
Reviews.Author: sjaneparker
Reviews.Content: Ugh- where to begin? I know! The internet. The hotel has 2 diff forms of internet. One for the rooms and one for the lobby (wireless) which is 7 Euro an hour. In this day and age to charge for internet is a complete crime, but at 7 an hour I should be getting a foot massage at the same time. And to top it off it only sporadically works well. Sometimes it can take 5 min to load a page (if it ever loads). And then there is the service- which is crappy and rude at best. The staff it seems are good natured people but they are obviously forced to do things they are not at all trained for. The room was clean and spare - fair enough. The area is terrible. Nothing here at all. I can see no reason to stay here unless it is a huge inconvenience to take transport in for a hotel. If there is ever another convention that I must attend here you can be sure as hell I will not be staying at this crap hole. Ps: there is a business center but be prepared to be nickel and dimed at every move, there is a fitness center that is adequate but no water fountain and the shop downstairs doesn't open till late so enjoy drinking tub water.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer053
Reviews.Content: I stayed in January 2009 for a conference on site. The hotel is very large but manages to keep a friendly feel. There are several wings, with up to 18 floors. I had a single (twin) room, which was clean and pleasant, on floor 12 of wing 2. Not too large, and nothing special, with simple modern furniture and the usual facilities. However, there is no safe and there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. There was a mini-bar, but no complimentary water. Also, this was not automatically re-stocked during my 3-night stay, and I ran out of bottled water on the last day (but there is a shop in the main atrium where this is sold at half the price). There was a hairdryer in the bathroom, but the liquid soap by the sink and liquid body wash/shampoo with conditioner were nothing special, so I was glad I'd taken my own. Unfortunately, my air conditioning didn't work, and some other delegates in my wing made the same comment. The hotel was quite warm, so the window in my room stayed open for the duration. There were plenty of electrical sockets available, and internet access (not wireless) was €3 per hour or €24 for 24 hours in the room. It was easy to set up and convenient. The breakfast areas in the main atrium were never too busy, and there is a very good choice. The staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel is not in an interesting area, so I would probably not stay here again or recommend it unless for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: JCTravel13
Reviews.Content: Without doubt this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I travelled with my wife who was a delegate at a conference. We paid extra for a larger room with more facilities. What these 'extra' facilities were we could not tell. The room was clean but very bare and only furnished with very basic cheap furniture First thing I noticed - NO ROOM SAFE - nowhere to keep a laptop or other valuables. The reception staff said we could keep valuables in the reception safe - just imagine 1000 delegates all trying to keep their laptops in one safe. In addition the hotel specifically stated that no resposibility would be taken for any valuables not in the hotel safe. The beds were adequate but the pillows were paper-thin - I needed three which were equal to one normal pillow. The towels were so thin and worn - a bit like trying to dry yourself on tissue paper. There were no normal toiletries - shampoo/conditioner /bar of soap. etc. even water for taking tablets had to be paid for at expensive minibar prices The sink plug did not retain water because it did not fit. The shower head was broken and hanging loose. There is no facility in the room to make a cup of tea or coffee - and there is no room service. There are no spa or swimming facilities. Food and drink are extremely expensive (the bar prices doubled during the period of the conference) At checkout they tried to charge us for using PayTV and argued with us to the point of shouting - quite disgraceful behaviour. They claimed that everybody tries to pretend that PayTV was not used. I know that it was not used at any time we were in the room - perhaps the management need to investigate their staff or their PayTV software. The location of the hotel is in a very undesirable area - you would not dream of going for a walkabout at night or even during the day. Security was nonexistent - anybody could enter the building and go anywhere to any floor in the hotel. The conference organisers had described this hotel as being an award winning hotel - somebody must be joking! Anyone thinking of staying at this hotel I would recommend to reconsider - there are far better and cheaper hotels in the centre of Berlin. e.g. 'The Swissotol' in the centre which is excellent in every way I hope this review may help anyone to avoid the experiences we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: bobsmith465
Reviews.Content: The Estrel is simply my favorite hotel. I come to Berlin every few months for a convention, and always chose to stay at this hotel. The prices are VERY fair compared to the other hotel prices in Berlin. The hotel features everything I need, restaurants, bars, and even live entertainment. The location next to the water and the train station provides easy access to the city center within 10 minutes. I would recommend this Hotel to all business travelers and families looking for a great vacation. Also, the Hotel is recently upgrading all of its rooms and suites. I slept in one of the new rooms, and I have to say they are great. The new style is more Asian-European, with bamboo wood, and art. VERY VERY NICE! Keep it up Estrel, you are simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Estrel the Great”
Reviews.Author: Mousafiris
Reviews.Content: The Estrel was a very pleasant surprise, after our booking at a more ''central'' Berlin hotel was not accepted at our arrival. Nice, clean, quiet rooms, new and enormous receptio - dining - bar area, excellent breakfast, and all at a very competitive price. We stayed at the Estrel during a business trip for an Exhibition and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The underground station is just a mere 2 minute stroll. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a good sleep”
Reviews.Author: Esporta
Reviews.Content: We stayed her ewhilst travelling on an Archers/Cosmos Eastern European tour in June 2008. As I did not know the actual cost of a room I could not assign value for money because expected quality must be related to price. This hotel was perfectly adequate for a good quiet night’s sleep in a large air- conditioned room with comfortable big beds and good bathroom facilities. The breakfast was excellent and in comfortable surroundings with items restocked by friendly staff. As a general comment regarding all our 9 hotels, the pillows were always so thin, or were so soft they ended up thin, that we always requested extras. They were delivered promptly at the Estrel. After long journey we were disappointed to see there was no tea making facilities in the room (this was the same in 8 out of the 9 hotels we used). Considering the hotel was massive I was surprised that it did not have a large gym and swimming pool. The isolated position of the hotel outside town means you do not have convenient access to the city for a stroll or to sample the nightlife in the evenings. This was not quite so important for older people, like myself, who only stopped 2 nights after tiring days of sightseeing. However, I would not stay here for a longer holiday. We did travel back to the hotel on the U-Bahn on one day and found it quite easy with one change required. I would not insult the locals by saying the area was seedy but it was not the sort of area you would choose for an after dinner stroll. We walked down to the local Lidl and did not find it at all intimidating.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedGent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of the convention that was located in this hotel. What a mistake. There was nothing good about place, nothing. Location, horrible bordering on dangerous. Make no mistake, you are a captive here ant they charge for simple thigns like a glass of water accordingly. And that's only when you can get serive to begin with. Service, slow and often times simply unavailable. Rooms, The worst. This place is like an old Russian prsion or something. Ugly and uncomfortable. No aircon and huge slabs of concrete walls to keep all that wonderful heat inside. Innaproporiate for the business traveller. Conference Rooms, what a joke ! Some were completely slapped together with temporary walls and often there were columns and blockages in the rooms. No two rooms were the same. A real mismash of styles and locations. Don't stay here under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Big but not great”
Reviews.Author: norcalty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before jumping on a train to Prague. The hotel is okay. The rooms are cheap looking Ikea decorated things. Trendy but cheap. The beds are not comfortable. They are thin and hard and the pillows are super thin; like putting a sheet under your head as a pillow. The bathrooms were clean and nice. Room was average and small as you would expect. Breakfast is above average with eggs, sausage, breads, cereals and more. Staff is okay, not overly friendly but not unfriendly. They are helpful in telling you how to get around town. It's a huge hotel so if you have a big group then it's a good place to stay. It's just around the corner from the Metro (about two short blocks) but it's in a slightly seedy area. We didn't have any problems even in the night walking around but it looks a bit scary. I think it's just very "Berlin"; the entire city looks a bit seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe”
Reviews.Author: Marlies84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a city-trip. The hotel is very big and even has capacity for dinnershows, etc. The room was very big, with a real nice bed and bathroom. The view was also nice. The location is another story. It's not very ideal for a city-trip, actually, because you have to take the tram to the centre. If i remember correctly, you even had to take two trams. But the hotel itself was very good. The breakfast was incredible. Loads of food and variety. And a very nice, light, breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mavericks21
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Estrel Hotel in Berlin during August, I was very impressed with the stay. The Hotel is the biggest in Europe, and as I work for a multinantional company, many of my collegues have stayed here before, and have always been impressed. The Estrel features a wide selection of restaurant choices, from traditional German, to Asian and French. The rooms itself are spacious and clean, not at all like the other person wrote in the review below. The Las Vegas style show was extraordinary, with great music and effects. The large conference area is equipped with the latest technology, and our conference over the weekend was very succesful. I hope that I will be able to return soon to this Hotel, which is excellent for tourists and businessmen alike!

Reviews.Title: “Not again, this place is horrible”
Reviews.Author: mare1205
Reviews.Content: Because of an on-going conference, I was forced to book a room at the Estrel. What a place. It might be great for some bus loads of tourists or school trips to the capital but definitely not for business. You feel you arrived in an American Shopping mall with some low key Las Vegas entertainment. Because we were late, we decided to eat in one of the restaurants. We choose the Italian place. The food was bad and the services really unfriendly. When I arrived in my room I thought I can't believe it - charming like a road side Etap Hotel. It was dirty, smelled badly and was noisy. No coat hangers, no hair dryer, not enough towels - may be they thought I should bring my own or they are afraid that they are getting stolen. The Estrel doesn't meet any Hotel standards, even if its for pleasure, party type of stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Not great location”
Reviews.Author: MuranoTA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to train station but far from city centre. The claim is that the hotel is the biggest hotel in Germany which has its advantages and disadvantages. The good thing is that there are a few restaurants on the ground floor so that you can grab a bite to eat. The hotel rooms are pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “only for business”
Reviews.Author: marais75012
Reviews.Content: While attending a 5 day conference, I spent two nights at the Estrel because I had to participate late in the evening or very early in the morning on two days. I was glad to be able to return to my usual accomodation in the city after two nights. The hotel itself is not bad; the rooms are bigger than average, clean and comfortable. I found the breakfast to be very good, and the personnel friendly. I found the restaurant area to be too noisy - it's more like a food court in a shopping center than three distinct restaurants, as they claim them to be. I abandoned my initial plan to invite a friend to their "top-notch" restaurant Sanssouci, as it does not look at all as classy as it seems on the web site. The biggest drawback of the hotel, however, is its location, as others have stated before. The hotel was chosen as a conference venue for its sheer size, as it was the only hotel in Berlin able to accomodate that many people. The hotel hosts a star look-alike show, which looks cheap judging from their advertisements, and gives an idea about the non-business public they try to attract. Definately not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Estrel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel to avoid. Looks great from outside especialy in the picture, never less it is located good 40 minutes from the center. If you are there as a turist or on a business this is a problem already. If you come for a conference like I did, it is a great dissapointment. Service is slow, unfriendly and in general no good, high overcharge for food, phone and internet, hotel personnel uses the guest's elevators to transfer their dirty beddings, food and dirty dishes. Rooms are average, however lacking even a coffe machine. Ice machines are non-existant. Originaly hotel informed me that they have a high speed internet acces in the rooms. Not true, internet is accesable only if you have your own WLAN card and ONLY from the main hall and -of course- for a substantial fee. In conclussion, I will never come again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference only- in the middle of nowhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: The hotel Estrel Hotel is enormous and looks like a casino. Its absolutely miles from the centre of Berlin. Don't bother staying here if your a tourist- if you have to because of a conference.(Which would then be bad luck!) Good luck if you find the ice machine which is supposed to be on a floor. Rooms are very ordinary but have the modern facilities. I do not want to write anymore about this hotel as it is extremely boring!!! We left and found a great hotel called Hotel Kastanienhof in Mitte. This area is fab because of the historical signifance to Germany. What to Do: Catch open bus around Berlin- see everything. Checkpoint Charlie a must. Drinks at Grand Westin Hotel - Mitte... Dinner at Berlin Hotel. Crosses at the Wall. Berlin Catheral, Brandebburger Tor....etc.etc. Overall Berlin is an expensive city but interesting for its historical value. A little too big for me. Give me Prague, Paris, Rome etc...

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: chitowntrvlrs
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very disappointed about the hotel. I was there for a global conference (Airline) so I was expecting to see at least some sense of global standards when it came to the hotel. Was I wrong, now I am not one to be petty, however, one would cetainly expect a hotel/conference center that claims to be the largest in Germany to have have a clock radio in the room, or a small coffee maker, individual ammenities for daily use instead of unitype orange colored hand/hair and body soap. The use of a iron and ironing board for more than 30 minutes whether you're done or not, it goes. Hotel restaurants that don't run out of food during lunch, The so called fitness center consisted of 1 treadmill, 1 stationary bike and 1 lifting machine and unless you're there at 0500 to workout, you can forget about using the equipment. This again is for a hotel that has 1,100 rooms. People posted the hotel was in the middle of no where and they were exactly right. Cab rides to/from the more active parts of the city were 19-24 euros and as much as the transit system was excellent, (I took it from Tegel to the hotel for 2e) spending a good amount of time on the train or bus is not what I would want to do again when visiting as I prefer walking. Could this be a very nice hotel, yes, but it has plenty of work to do to get there.
